metadata.title: CVE-2021-44648 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
GNOME gdk-pixbuf 2.42.6 is vulnerable to a heap-buffer overflowvulnerability when decoding the lzw compressed stream of image data in GIFfiles with lzw minimum code size equals to 12.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-44648` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gdk-pixbuf-tests - 2.42.8+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
gir1.2-gdkpixbuf-2.0 - 2.42.8+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
libgdk-pixbuf-2.0-0 - 2.42.8+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
libgdk-pixbuf2.0-bin - 2.42.8+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
libgdk-pixbuf2.0-common - 2.42.8+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gdk-pixbuf package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.42.8+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1').
